net.nologin.meep.tbv

Class GenericTileProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.nologin.meep.tbv.GenericTileProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TileProvider

    public class GenericTileProvider
extends java.lang.Object
implements TileProvider
    This class is a very basic/test provider implementation and is the default provider, should the developer forget to register their own with the TiledBitmapView. It provides some sensible defaults for the less important methods, so can also be extended instead of having to implement your own TileProvider from scratch.

    It creates placeholder bitmap on construction (A yellow circle on a grey background with the text 'no provider registered'), and every tile served by this provider reuses it. It serves only as a minimalistic base/default class and should not be used as an example for your own provider especially any that does anything more complicated than this one does.

    To write a proper provider, take a look at the detailed javadoc of the TileProvider interface, and also checkout the DemoTileProvider implementation in the TiledBitmapViewDemo project for a proper example on how to asynchronously generate bitmaps.
    See Also:
    TiledBitmapView, TileProvider

      • getConfigGridAnchor

        public GridAnchor getConfigGridAnchor()
        Description copied from interface: TileProvider
        When one of the moveTo* methods in TiledBitmapView is called, the desired Tile will be moved into view. This GridAnchor value defines where exactly on the screen that Tile will end up. In map-style views (or if unsure), generally GridAnchor.Center is sufficent.

        Thread: Main UI - See class javadoc
        Specified by:
        getConfigGridAnchor in interface TileProvider
        Returns:
        The relative position on the screen that target tiles will be rendered.

      • hasFreshData

        public boolean hasFreshData()
        Description copied from interface: TileProvider
        Useful when this provider performs background queue processing, this method is polled by the view to check if there are fresh bitmaps to include in the next rendering of the surface. The implementation of this method should probably toggle the flag back to false in order to prevent unecessary repeat renderings.

        Thread: Surface Renderer (Not UI) - See class javadoc
        Specified by:
        hasFreshData in interface TileProvider
        Returns:
        true if this provider has generated new bitmap data that should be included since the last call.

      • getConfigTileIDLimits

        public java.lang.Integer[] getConfigTileIDLimits()
        Description copied from interface: TileProvider
        If specified, scrolling past these tile ID limits in the view will be prohibited.
        Useful to prevent scrolling past excessive ranges, or also in conjuction with TileProvider.getConfigGridAnchor() when your data has a logical boundary. Unspecified behaviour occurs if the bounds are too restrictive (ie, less than the initial range displayed on the screen).

        Thread: Main UI - See class javadoc
        Specified by:
        getConfigTileIDLimits in interface TileProvider
        Returns:
        null if there are no restrictions on scrolling. Otherwise, a 4-element Integer array should be specified, specifying the left, top, right, and bottom ID limits respectively. Each individual element can be null to selectively allow unlimited scrolling. Eg, to enforce that scrolling up can't go beyond x=5, then specify {null,null,5,null}. Invalid arrays will be ignored (same as null).

      • onTileIDRangeChange

        public void onTileIDRangeChange(TileRange newRange)
        Description copied from interface: TileProvider
        Called by the view when it calculates a change in the visble tile range. This gives the provider a chance to clear out older cached data, or to trigger background tasks to generate/fetch new tile bitmap data. Return true from TileProvider.hasFreshData() to let the view know when any background task has produced new data it can use.

        Thread: Main UI - See class javadoc
        Specified by:
        onTileIDRangeChange in interface TileProvider
        Parameters:
        newRange - The boundaries of the tile IDs fpsTimeNow on display.

        Thread: Main UI - See class javadoc
        Specified by:
        onZoomFactorChange in interface TileProvider
        Parameters:
        newZoom - a float value from 1.0 to 5.0 (initial is 1.0)

      • getDebugSummary

        public java.lang.String getDebugSummary()
        Description copied from interface: TileProvider
        Generate a short summary string with the state of this provider. When TiledBitmapView.setDebugEnabled(boolean) has been set true, this string will be displayed as part of the debug information at the bottom right. Although only called during debug mode, depending on your provider, it may be called a lot, so keep it as resource efficient as possible.

        Thread: Surface Renderer (Not UI) - See class javadoc
        Specified by:
        getDebugSummary in interface TileProvider
        Returns:
        Short descriptive summary of this provider's state, eg "MyProv[cache=100,blah=123]".
